body.name: Rocket Stove Rocket Stove for Cooking Portable Wood Mini Burning Stove, Fire Camping Stove for Cooking backyard cooking Camping grill outdoor events BBQ Comes with storage bag
deliveryMessages: Or fastest delivery Thursday, February 15. Order within 5 hrs 53 mins
Or fastest pickup Tomorrow, February 14. Order within 5 hrs 53 mins
features: Excellent Structural Design:The structure of the rocket stove achieves a chimney effect by allowing hot air to rise and sucking in more cold air at the bottom, improving combustion efficiency and making the fire more powerful!

High Quality:The rocket stove is made of 0.072‘’ thick Q235 steel, which does not deform even at temperatures over 1500°F, with a stable structure and a load capacity of over 130 pounds at the top, making it very durable. The surface of the rocket stove is sprayed with a high temperature resistant fireproof finish that will not peel even at temperatures exceeding 1500 degrees Fahrenheit.

Ease of use:This wood-burning stove can be used by simply installing a pot holder at the top and an anti-tip bar at the bottom.The wood stove combustion chamber is tilted, and the wood ashes will automatically slide out after burning, making it easy to replenish the wood.

Easy to carry:Equipped with a storage bag, measuring 8.85 x 13 x 3.93 inches, the woodstove can easily fit into the bag, which weighs only 5.62 pounds when loaded.It is convenient to carry and does not occupy much space. It is an ideal choice for outdoor use.

Wide range of uses:Suitable for camping, hiking, outdoor cooking, mountain climbing, and disaster prevention. The materials to fuel this wood stove can be found anywhere, such as twigs, leaves, weeds, sticks, etc.

manufacturerProductDescription.media_text: Outstanding Combustion Effects More efficient combustion due to the chimney effect. Stronger heat and less smoke during combustion.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on September 5, 2023
reviews.reviewText: I like the fact that it isn't really ant larger that 2 loafs of bread, not heavy yet still seems to be well made.. First lighting it worked great. Burned off any oils and suck from manufacturing. When the smells burned off I threw my cast iron skillet on it and fried up some fish. Used nothing more than the twigs from the trees in my yard.. I think that it would be great for camping for 1-2 people, more if you have the time as you can only use one pot or skillet at a time.. I'm happy with it

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on November 18, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Rocket Stove cooks a memorable afternoon lunch!!
reviews.reviewText: Very easy to assemble, sturdy construction, instructions are on the outside of the box it shipped to. We had a pleasant experience with our grands grilling cheese sandwiches with our new stove. They had so much fun gathering twigs and it only took about 15 minutes to start grilling. I was very impressed with the quality of the stove and the ease of use strong construction and thoughtful design impressed me! You won’t use this for backpacking in the wilds it’s too bulky to carry far but that’s a good thing as it shows the quality of the construction. What does it need? Not much! The paver was a handy solution to prevent the deck from the heat.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 25, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 4.0 out of 5 stars Burn hot on just a few twigs, but not easy to regulate
reviews.reviewText: I did use it in my last outing and found it to be working well. Specially if you want to bring water to a boil for say coffee, it works great. If you need to boil something for a few minutes like pasta or rice it is a bit flaky. At least on my stove the air vent always flips back open meaning if you have enough fuel the flame may be too hot. I had a hard time to keep the heat controlled causing the pot to boil over every so often.Best used with a wider pot or pan with metal handles.Vent / flame control is marginal at best. A tray for the ashes would have been nice.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on November 24, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Definitely worth the money.
reviews.reviewText: If you like camping this thing beats the hell out of a propane stove. It doesn't get as hot but you don't have to worry about stupid propane bottles running out and all that other nonsense. You could push it into duty for backpacking if you wanted to carry it it's relatively small I doubt it would fit in your pack but it comes with a nice little carry bag and it doesn't weigh anything especially since you don't have to Lug fuel around with it. And it's considerably better than those little folding junkers they sell for backpacking. I have had no trouble cooking meals for three on this thing. The secret is don't overload it it will choke and keep the ash area clear so it can properly draw. Playing with this thing I've used sticks I gathered up in the desert I cut down store-bought firewood into chunks about 1 in by 3 in and I tried charcoal briquettes and even Cow Patties this thing Burns it all.. it took me about an hour in a light Breeze to cook a 20 inch cast iron skillet full of burrito Stuffins. Was about two and a half pounds of ground beef onions refried beans seasoning. And it did it on three loads of the 1x3 inch cut up seasoned firewood. And I didn't have to hunch over a campfire getting smoked out to do it. I'm probably going to buy one or two more of these things to squirrel away in my prepping gear. I like this one over the others because this one you can dampen down and simmer stuff or keep a pot of coffee warm.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on November 26, 2023
reviews.reviewText: it works as advertised. small, sturdy, well made and functional.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on November 30, 2023
reviews.reviewText: It’s a smaller rocket stove which is what I was looking for. It’s really light and has a nice bag that it stows away in.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on December 20, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 3.0 out of 5 stars did not perform well fire chamber was just to small
reviews.reviewText: It was a good idea and design if only it would have been lager, unfortunately it did not perform well and was not versatile enough because fire chamber was just to small

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on October 25, 2023
reviews.reviewText: This is a well built, rugged kit with essential pieces that fit inside and a nice carrying case to keep it all together. Burns small debris but creates an intense flame for cooking.
